001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump;
002
003import java.util.Map;
004import java.util.stream.Stream;
005
006/**
007 * This interface represents the ability to dump the data of JSON-like and YAML-like
008 * hierarchical structure in multicolor TEXT-base, HTML-base and SVG-base formats.
009 * <hr/>
010 * The main Object-Oriented Design Pattern that is used in this package is called <b>Visitor</b>
011 * and the <i>visited</i> hierarchy is represented by inner-class {@link Node} and its subclasses,
012 * where this outer interface {@link TreeDumper} is a <i>visitor</i>,
013 * that accepts <i>visit</i>-events and walks through the rest of nodes hierarchy
014 * in a <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depth-first_search">Depth First Search</a> manner.
015 * <hr/>
016 * Implementations of this interface are responsible for the target logical structure
017 * ({@link org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.render.Highlight.Structure#JSON JSON}
018 * or {@link org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.render.Highlight.Structure#YAML YAML})
019 * and the target output format (see {@link org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.dump.render.Highlight.Target Target}-enum)
020 *
021 * @see <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Visitor_pattern">
022 *     (Wikipedia) Visitor pattern
023 * </a>
024 * @see <a href="https://www.baeldung.com/java-visitor-pattern">
025 *     (Baeldung) Visitor Design Pattern in Java
026 * </a>
027 * @see <a href="https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/system-design/visitor-design-pattern/">
028 *     (Geeks For Geeks) Visitor design pattern
029 * </a>
030 * @see <a href="https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/visitor-design-pattern-java">
031 *     (Digital Ocean) Visitor Design Pattern in Java
032 * </a>
033 */
034public interface TreeDumper {
035
036    interface Node {
037        default String identity() { return null; }
038        default String comment() { return null; }
039        void visit(TreeDumper dumper);
040    }
041
042    interface ScalarNode extends Node {
043        String text();
044    }
045
046    interface SequenceNode extends Node {
047        Stream<Node> sequenceItems();
048    }
049
050    interface MappingsNode extends Node {
051        Stream<Map.Entry<String, Node>> mappingsItems();
052    }
053
054    Node NULL = TreeDumper::acceptNull;
055
056    void acceptNull();
057    void acceptScalar(ScalarNode scalarNode);
058    void acceptSequence(SequenceNode sequenceNode);
059    void acceptMappings(MappingsNode mappingsNode);
060
061    default void acceptRoot(Node rootNode) {
062        rootNode.visit(this);
063    }
064}
